newsitem.title: USA: Intuit reports higher second quarter profit.
newsitem.headline: Intuit reports higher second quarter profit.

text.p: Intuit Inc., the maker of popular personal finance software such as Quicken and TurboTax, Thursday reported a sharp increase in second quater profits, reflecting a one-time gain from the sale of its online banking service and strong demand for its tax software.
The Mountain View, Calif.-based company earned $115.9 million, or $2.44 a share, in the three months ended Jan. 31, up from $21.9 million, or 46 cents a share, a year ago
Revenues rose 21 percent to $266.0 million from $219.0 million in the year ago quarter.

The latest quarterly results included a gain on the sale of discontinued operations of $71.2 million in connection with the sale of Intuit's online banking and bill payment transaction processing business to CheckFree Corp.

Net income, excluding acquisition-related expenses and the gain on the sale of discontinued operations, increased 28 percent to $52.3 million, or $1.10 per share, compared with net income, excluding acquisition related charges and a loss from discontinued operations, of $40.8 million, or 85 cents a share, for the year ago quarter.
The operating profit was slightly above Wall Street expectations.
Intuit typically reports strong results in the January quarter, reflecting the seasonal nature of the company's tax return preparation products.
Intuit shares fell 12.5 cents to $25.375 on Nasdaq.
